t: Genesis 10
The Table of Nations
This*p is the account of Shem, Ham and Japheth, Noah’s sons, who themselves had sons after the flood.
The Japhethites
The*ln sons of Japheth: Gomer,*ld Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshek and Tiras.
The*ln sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz,*ld Riphath and Togarmah.
The*ln sons of Javan: Elishah,*ld Tarshish, the Kittites and the Rodanites.
(From these the maritime peoples spread out into their territories by their clans within their nations, each with its own language.)
The Hamites
The*ln sons of Ham: Cush,*ld Egypt, Put and Canaan.
The*ln sons of Cush: Seba,*ld Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah and Sabteka. The*ln sons of Raamah: Sheba*ld and Dedan.
Cush*p was the father of Nimrod, who became a mighty warrior on the earth.
He was a mighty hunter before the Lord;*s that is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the Lord.”*s
The first centers of his kingdom were Babylon, Uruk, Akkad and Kalneh, in Shinar.
From that land he went to Assyria, where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah
and Resen, which is between Nineveh and Calah—which is the great city.
Egypt*pln was the father of the*ld Ludites, Anamites, Lehabites, Naphtuhites,
Pathrusites, Kasluhites (from whom the Philistines came) and Caphtorites.
Canaan*ln was the father of Sidon*ld his firstborn, and of the Hittites,
Jebusites, Amorites, Girgashites,
Hivites, Arkites, Sinites,
Arvadites, Zemarites and Hamathites. Later*p the Canaanite clans scattered
and the borders of Canaan reached from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboyim, as far as Lasha.
These*p are the sons of Ham by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
The Semites
Sons*p were also born to Shem, whose older brother was Japheth; Shem was the ancestor of all the sons of Eber.
The*pln sons of Shem: Elam,*ld Ashur, Arphaxad, Lud and Aram.
The*ln sons of Aram: Uz,*ld Hul, Gether and Meshek.
Arphaxad*ln was the father of Shelah, and*ld Shelah the father of Eber.
Two*ln sons were born to Eber: One*ld was named Peleg, because in his time the earth was divided; his brother was named Joktan.
Joktan*ln was the father of Almodad,*ld Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
Ophir, Havilah and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.
The*p region where they lived stretched from Mesha toward Sephar, in the eastern hill country.
These*p are the sons of Shem by their clans and languages, in their territories and nations.
These*p are the clans of Noah’s sons, according to their lines of descent, within their nations. From these the nations spread out over the earth after the flood.
